title: Dark Pontifex
opening: With the aid of the White Sage Gotoh’s powerful Warp magic, Marth and company were transported to the faraway city of Thabes. Once, Thabes was an advanced civilization; but only its decay advanced now. The League traced the lifeless streets to the temple at the city’s heart, somewhere within its walls Gharnef was waiting, and now, Marth must wrest Falchion and his sister, Elice, from the fiend’s grip.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: The Temple of Thabes... He’s here... somewhere...
Heh heh heh... Come to play, little Marth?

intro.speaker: Gharnef
intro.line: ‘Tis I, Gharnef. I have been waiting for you.

intro.speaker: Gharnef
intro.line: Oh yes. For you to dance around the continent, collecting powerful weapons and killing off my competition. Thanks to you, Camus and Michalis will trouble me no more. You have my gratitude, diligent prince.

intro.speaker: Gharnef
intro.line: Tsk, tsk, don’t spoil the moment, now. You’re about to do me one last favor... Die, Prince. Heh heh heh!

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: That’s what you think. I have something else in mind.

intro.speaker: Gharnef
intro.line: Heh, is that a threat? If you mean to harm me, first you’ll have to find me, boy.

intro.speaker: Marth
intro.line: And what is that supposed to mean?

intro.speaker: Malledus
intro.line: My prince! Several sorcerers have been sighted throughout the temple! They’re... They all seem to be Gharnef, sire!

intro.speaker: Gharnef
intro.line: Heh heh! Fight, boy, fight! Wear yourself thin fighting puppets and shadows! But the only way you’ll claim Falchion is by defeating the real me. Heh heh, ha ha ha ha!

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: Sire, we’ve pinpointed where Gharnef is keeping the magical apparatus that gives him his power.

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: The Tower of Thabes atop this very temple.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Then we don’t need to fight Gharnef... If we find those apparatus.

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: Gharnef’s power- a great deal of power- will be sealed forever.

battle.speaker: Marth
battle.line: Then let’s hurry and seize the entrance to the tower!

battle.speaker: Malledus
battle.line: A word of caution, sir. Stopping the apparatus will not undo Imhullu power- only Gharnef’s. He still has Falchion in his keeping; if you want the blade back, you must defeat him now, before seizing the tower.

boss.speaker: Gharnef
boss.line: Heh heh heh... You dare challenge me, fool? You must not value your life. Cower before the might of the dark magic Imhullu!

boss.speaker: Gharnef
boss.line: Agh! What... Where did you get...Starlight...? Still, you are a fool...Your power is not enough to defeat Medeus... I shall be waiting in the pits of the inferno... for when he sends you to join me... Heh heh, ha ha ha!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Malledus! Quickly! Find the apparatus and shut them down!

end.speaker: Gharnef
end.line: ...Blast! How... how did they find the apparatus? All my power... Still, they are fools if they think they can defeat Medeus with such cheap tricks... Heh heh, ha ha ha!

end.speaker: Malledus
end.line: Gharnef is getting away, sire! Shall we give chase?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: No... let him go. Without his magical apparatus, he has no power left to abuse.

end.speaker: Allied Solider
end.line: Sire! We found Princess Elice up in the Tower of Thabes! She’s on her way to see you right- Ah, here she is!

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: Marth! Oh look at you. A man grown!

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Sister, I was so worried. None had seen you since the castle fell. I... I feared the worst.

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: I was prepared for the worst, if that was what it took to ensure your safety. But they did not kill me. Gharnef spared my life.

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: Marth, have you heard of the staff of Aum?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: The staff that brings back the dead? It was lost to the world long ago, or so the legend goes.

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: Yes, but Gharnef found it... in the Resurrectory.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: The Resurrectory? What was it doing in a temple in the middle of Dolhr?

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: I could not say. But that was why Gharnef kept me alive: he wished me to wield it. The staff of Aum’s power can only be channeled by women of royal blood. Marth, you are going to Dolhr, are you not?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Yes. I must settle things with Medeus.

end.speaker: Elice
end.line: Then take me to the Resurrectory along the way to claim the staff. Aum works but once, but I will use it to revive a lost comrade.
